
### position dependence  {.smaller}

* two ways of encoding addresses in x86-64 assembly: 
   * address in little endian (typically 32-bits --- limit on executable size)
   * (usually 32-bit) difference between address and %rip (next instruction address)

<hr />
<table style="width:100%">
<tr><th>assembly</th><th> encoding</th></tr>
<tr><td>`movq label, %al`<br />[or Intel: `mov AL, [label]`]{.my-small}</td><td>`8a 04 25`&nbsp;<i>label addr</i></td></tr>
<tr><td>`jmp *label`<br />[or Intel: `jmp [label]`]{.my-small}</td><td>`ff 24 25`&nbsp;<i>label addr</i></td></tr>
<tr><td>`mov label(%rip), %al`<br />[or Intel NASM: `mov AL, [REL label]`]{.my-small}</td><td>`8a 05`&nbsp;<i>%rip - label addr</i></td></tr>
<tr><td>`jmp *label(%rip), %al`<br />[or Intel NASM: `jmp [REL label]`]{.my-small}</td><td>`e9`&nbsp;<i>%rip - label addr</i></td></tr>
</table>
